intro: Gramen americanum, commonly known as common grass or tall goldenrod, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and clusters of yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist to wet habitats such as marshes, swamps, and along stream banks. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often have a hairy texture. Gramen americanum plays an important role in supporting pollinators and stabilizing wetland soils.
